title: Front Brake Master Cylinder - Removal

body.body: Make sure the motorcycle is stabilised and adequately supported.
A correctly supported motorcycle will help prevent it from falling.
An unstable motorcycle may fall, causing injury to the operator or damage to the motorcycle.
Caution - Do not spill brake fluid
To prevent paint damage, do not spill brake fluid onto any area of the bodywork. Spilled brake fluid will damage paintwork.

To drain the fluid from the master cylinder, attach a tube to the front brake caliper bleed nipple, loosen the nipple and operate the brake lever until all fluid has been expelled into a suitable container.
Disconnect the brake hose from the master cylinder and discard the two sealing washers.
Detach the brake light switch and bracket from the master cylinder.
Remove the two fixings and detach the switch housing from the handlebar.

body.name: Detach front master switch housing cjos

body.body: Remove the pivot bolt and lock nut securing the brake lever to the master cylinder. Remove the brake lever.
Note the orientation of the twist grip position sensor for installation.
Release the fixings securing the twist grip position sensor to the master cylinder. Discard the fixings.
Release the clamp fixings from the handlebar to remove the master cylinder.
Fixings for the twist grip position sensor
